comments.comment:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/filipecosta90>@filipecosta90</denchmark-link> can you look into the firstÂ memory errors? I can't see anything wrong with it. What's happening is that the RedisAI backend loads a C++ library (libtorch_c), which is compiled using a standard allocator (not zmalloc or whatever Redis is built with) dynamically. Since I need to return an error string that will then be deallocated by Redis itself, what I do is pass the allocator as part of the function to the libtorch_c API, <denchmark-code>extern "C" void* torchCompileScript(const char* script, DLDeviceType device, int64_t device_id, char **error, void* (*alloc)(size_t)) </denchmark-code>
If an exception is thrown, I allocate the error string using the allocator that is passed by the caller, and strcpy the content of the description of the exception into this zmalloc allocated buffer <denchmark-code> size_t len = strlen(e.what()); *error = (char*)alloc(len * sizeof(char)); strcpy(*error, e.what()); return NULL; </denchmark-code>
I might be doing something stupid here but I can't see it.
I saw it in the end :-) I need to delete ctx before returning...
